alert.note: Alert for Geneva; Houston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 02 at 6:48PM CST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Alabama, including the following counties, Geneva and Houston. * WHEN...Until 845 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 648 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dothan, Geneva, Hartford, Taylor, Kinsey, Ashford, Slocomb, Cowarts, Webb, Malvern, Rehobeth, Avon, Black, Memphis, Bald Hill, Bailey Crossroad, Wicksburg, Dundee and Hollis Dairy Road. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
